name: Dr. Elliot Cross
role: Protagonist - SETI Signal Analyst and reluctant time traveler
core_wound: Grew up as child of deterministic atheist father who taught that free will is illusion. Spent life trying to prove choices matter. Discovering he's living a predestined loop destroys his philosophical foundation.
wants: To understand the signal and break free from the temporal loop
needs: To accept that choice can matter even within determinism - that how you walk the path is freedom
voice_markers: Noir internal monologue - cynical, observational ('The rain didn't care about my problems')
Questions phrased as statements ('I wasn't sure if I was remembering or predicting')
Temporal confusion in tense - shifts between past/present/future mid-sentence
Philosophical asides about free will and causality
Dark humor about determinism ('I chose to have no choice')
contradiction: Fights against predetermined fate while using future knowledge to navigate present. Claims to want freedom while following the script. Seeks to break the loop while knowing loop must complete.
physical_description: Perpetually exhausted, dark circles under gray eyes. Unkempt dark hair showing early gray. Wears same clothes for days - doesn't see point in maintaining appearance. Notebook full of annotations in different handwriting (his own, across loops). Chain smoker despite knowing it doesn't matter.

temporal_state.meets_future_self_ch35: Converses with self from loop iterations
temporal_state.temporal_entanglement_ch52: Consciousness unstuck in time - living multiple moments simultaneously
